comment: Pretty rude in his response to things. Asked for a little lenience after getting into a car accident and missing an assignment and got told to use a calendar. I'm almost 30 Garrett.

I enjoyed this class and learned a lot throughout the course! There will be a 10-page essay, which you will have plenty of time to write. There are also discussion posts about every week along with a short quiz (timed) to go over the reading material and lectures. You will need to go over the text for this course in order to succeed!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: He is a great professor with a sense of humor. He gives plenty of feedback and will respond quickly to your inquiries.

As a Maymester, Dr. Smith's class was much easier than I expected going into it. There was a lecture, an article to read, and a response for every day. Responses had to be submitted and copied to a discussion board, where a reply to a classmates post was needed. Overall 9 graded "essays," all short and simple. Follow his rubrics and its an easy A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took Dr. Smith for GEOG 7900 (online). The content was thought-provoking and sequenced well. For every assignment, he provided clear and manageable expectations on the rubric; then gave feedback for areas needing improvement and encouragement in strengths. He posted weekly pick-me-up messages which was a nice touch. I'm taking him again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Solid and straight-forward. Expect to spend about 45 minutes a week on this class. Weekly reading, 300 word discussion posts and quizzes (which are Lockdown Browser). 3 Metacognition exercises throughout semester, all of which are easy A's. Quizzes are T/F and can be somewhat difficult but never too bad. Overall, would recommend, he's prettyyy easy
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: He's a super tough grader. he will nitpick everything in your weekly 400-word discussion post. 1 large essay due at the end of the semester, try and find someone else because his online class has almost no direction.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Pretty easy professor. Weekly discussion posts and quizzes, but quizzes are true/false based and are worded tricky. You'll only spend about an hour a week on his online geography course.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: I have taken professor Smith for both GEOG 3350 and 3340 and, I can honestly say that he is an awesome professor. Yes, he does require you to write a 10-page research paper in 4 weeks (over Summer Sem.), He does grade the discussions "honestly" Having said all of that, the workload is easily manageable and, I am taking 12 credit hours over Summer!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: I took an online summer course. He gives fill in the blank quizzes every other day, and if you dont capitalize your answer the entire question is wrong. If youre 1 letter short from his 300 word discussions or 100 word responses, hell give drop you a bunch of points. Hes not a bad guy, but I dont understand how he has such good ratings.

Stickler. List all of your sources for your 300 word discussion but don't cite them in in-line text? That's a 0. Two words off of the 300 word count for a discussion? That's a letter grade lower. Be prepared to play by his rules and follow the rubrics to a T. An A is quite possible but be prepared to live in solitary with the work load.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Professor Smith is a great option for cultural geography, his grading structure centers around average length discussion posts, tests, quizzes and the 10-page research paper (arguably the hardest part of this class). Take Him, Seriously!!!!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Smith is a great professor. I took him for World Regional Geography. Weekly discussion posts and quizzes. The quizzes are a bit challenging, but he drops the lowest. Three very simple papers (about you and how you study). This class was interesting and taught me more about our world. I am happy I took the class and I'm glad I took it with him.
His class is not as easy as you might think it's going to be but he makes sure that you learn your material that you need to pass the class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Prof Smith is AMAZING. Dont be intimidated by the 10 page paper, he wants you to do well and will help you along the way. His tests are the only tricky things because you really need to listen during class and take good notes. Some of the questions are things you wouldn't think are important. But just read the book and take notes, and youre fine!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: I took his class as a Maymester, and let me tell you - it was the easiest class I've ever taken! I made a LEGITIMATE 100. For the Maymester, you have a quiz (T/F) on a powerpoint, daily readings and discussions (300 words), and a 300 word conclusion post. Super, super easy as long as you FOLLOW HIS PROPTS AND RUBRIC!! Great class and easy A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Smith was a very great instructor! I took him online for Cultural Geography and there was no need of a text book, just weekly article readings that he provides. There a discussion post each week and also a quiz to go along with the power point. The final is a 10 page essay (which you shouldn't wait last minute to do). Overall very easy A!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Tests? Not many--Would take again

comment: The only real work is the final 10 page paper (which he gives you ample time to write!) the rest of the class is SUPER easy. Every week you focus on a new/different aspect of cultural geography, and all you have to do is an easy quiz (solely based on powerpoint) and write up a short post and respond to another student's post. TAKE THIS CLASS!

Dr. Smith is a fantastic professor! He has a lot of knowledge about Geography and is always willing to help. He requires a lot of reading and expects you to answer questions about the reading in class. The discussion questions are always answered in groups though which makes it less stressful. Overall, I would highly recommend taking Dr. Smith!

He is pretty smug. He does not give direct answers to any question (almost as if it is beneath him).  I must admit he is a fair grader. If you work for it you will be rewarded. Test are hard, only because he ask questions that a normal person wouldn't think twice about. The paper is ok. It is a decent class, a "B" is easy, a "A" is difficult.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I have taken his Maymester class and it is intense. Start off strong by reading through the  textbook before you take the class. He is intense however, if you read daily, complete the daily assignments and focus  you should earn at the least a B in his class.

Cultuural Geography is a great deal of material to learn over the summer.  You are expected to memorize chapters in a few days with timed tests that don't allow you any time to look up answers.  Very difficult class for the summer.  Tough tests and tough grading.  For maymester, expect to read 2 chapters 1 night with a test on it the next.  Impossi
This is a tough class for maymester.  So much memorizing in a short time period and the tests are impossible.  You have to memorize 40 pages each night.  Don't doo it.
Super hard class for the summer.  Too much material in a short time period.  Extreemely hard tests.  Avoid
The online class is toughh with lots of busy work and hard tests.  Very limited time for online tests with tricky questions.
Long research paper over summer and tons of work for maymester class.  You will have no life for 2 weeks.

I have taken him online and in the physical classroom. Take him Online, but I can't recommend him for a physical class. The quizzes are in group format and you are only given a few minutes to complete them. The midterm was hard, really hard. You have to take notes, read and study to do well on the midterm!

Great class. Online Maymester. Simple, straight-forward. Discussion Posts and Quizzes for each chapter. Being a 2 week course, there was no final exam or project. Easiest A of my life and interesting content.

Take him if you can! He is very kind and helpful. I've taken him for two other classes as well. His format is pretty much the same. Weekly quiz and discussion post. 10-page research paper. (I got a 95!) If you keep up with the weekly assignments and the research paper, you'll make an A!

Easy, easy class. The only bad part was the 10 page research paper ( I made a 92!) but he gives you 5 weeks to work on it and doesn't assign anything else for those weeks. The modules go quickly post a simple discussion board post and a reply and you get an A. The quizzes can be tough but read and listen to the lecture and you'll be okay!

Dr. Smith is a laid back teacher and an easy grader. Tests can be challenging. His lectures are not posted online but everything comes from the book.  He cares about geography a lot. Attendance is mandatory.

The class is filled with redundant material that you cover in anthropology and sociology classes. This professor doesn't care about the content of your work, just the word count. He's condescending and rude. Probably one of the worse teachers and classes I've ever had.
This class was really easy and interesting. Smith is a very easy grader, and if you like GEOG, he is great to take.

I liked Geog. of Sub-Saharan Africa. The videos we watched and the lectures given were pretty straight forward. There was one 10 pg. paper, midterm, final exam, and other small assignments. Everyone also had to present there research (power point). I thought some of the units could have been lecture over more in depth, but the class was interesting

Online class: one 10 page paper. 1 quiz timed and paper (discussion) per week. Keep up with your work and you will do fine. Provides encouragment and feedback on your work. He very clear about what is expected. Great professor!
Very interesting class online. Weekly discussions (350+ words) and one 10-page research paper. Very straightforward. Definitely recommend him.

Great guy. He is definitely one of the most laid back teachers at this university. We have weekly quizzes, pretty easy. The tests are essays and he gives you the essay question the week before the test, so you can gather ideas. Take him if you can!
great guy; soft spoken. Teaches from vague powerpoints. Offers extra credit. takes attendance. Helpful

Really laid back guy. The class itself was a little unorganized but he kept it interesting with movies and guest speakers. Attendance isn't required either which is always nice. Tests were multiple choice and essay. He gave essay before so you could prepare too. I'd take again and recommend.

Great and Easy... two problems... ALWAYS wears black jeans... we had an ongoing joke about him, and he would never answer questions. If you asked one he would tell you to get back to him.  If you're teaching a class you should have the answer, or know enough about it to BS an answer.

What a great teacher. Absolutely awsome in every way. Keeps class interested and active in the learning process. Even his tests are fun. Among the very best teachers and people you'd meet. Very handsome too!!

Dr Smith is a great teacher. He knows a lot and communicates well. Economic Geography is a complicated subject and he explains it well. He is very eager to help and answers all your questions. DONT EVEN THINK ABOUT MISSING CLASS! You will miss out on important test material. 2 Exams, 1 paper & presentation, and a couple of map exercises.

Great professor! Brings his own travels and experiences into class which makes it interesting and fun. Tests are mostly from lecture, occasionally he'll throw in something from book. Atlas questions are open book but it doesn't hurt to know where places are. Gives essay questions in advance which is good. Considering minor now in Geo thanks to him.

He was a great teacher!  The tests come mostly from class lectures.  There is an essay question but he gives it to you a week before the test.  He has been to a lot of different places so he is very knowledgeable.  As long as you attend class and take notes, you'll have an A.  I highly recommend him!

Teacher teaches by the stomp stomp technique.  That means that if he says something twice or writes it on the board it is on a test.  No papers and projects are pier graded.  Easy and fun class that uses the real world experiences of the prof to get the material to the student.
No Comments

Easy class for the most part, tests come from lectures, there is an essay question, however he gives it to you beforehand.  You do have to do a group presentation which is graded by the others in the class, and they can be even more harsh than the prof.
I had him for cultural geography and it was an interesting class and he is an interesting teacher.  Expect a 10-page research paper but the rest of the class is a breeze.
Easy class.  Easy prof.  Show up, take notes.  Don't bother buying book.  Test are all from notes.
No Comments
